intro: Galatella aragonensis, commonly known as the Aragonese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
